metadata.title: CVE-2019-9453 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In the Android kernel in F2FS touch driver there is a possible out ofbounds read due to improper input validation. This could lead to localinformation disclosure with system execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9453` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1078-aws - 4.4.0-1078.82
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.82').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1').
